intro: Brunfelsiopsis, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous, and often found growing in rocky or sandy soils. They are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, cruciform flowers that are usually white or yellow. Brunfelsiopsis species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging environments. They play a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local insect populations.
